intro: Cochlearia coronopus, commonly known as the crown corse, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles and parts of northern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, preferring sandy or gravelly soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it produces small, rounded seed pods that mature in the summer. The species is known for its resilience to harsh maritime conditions and is often found in disturbed or coastal habitats.
